p: The capitulum inflorescences are gathered in loose panicles growing from the axils of the leaves. In these semicircular or circular heterogamous capitulum there are light-yellow ligulate female flowers, and tubular hermaphroditic flowers. The involucral bracts covering the capitulum are long and grey, with ensiform outer and oval inner leaves [ 1, 12] The flowering period of the plant in Central Europe begins towards the end of July and lasts until October [ 7, 12].
